sn37.14:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo …pe… nirayaṃ upapajjati.
sn37.14:1.1.eng: “Anuruddha, when ladies have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

sn37.14:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātī ca hoti, adinnādāyī ca hoti, kāmesumicchācārī ca hoti, musāvādī ca hoti, surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhāyī ca hoti—
sn37.14:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

sn37.14:1.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatī”ti.
sn37.14:1.4.eng: When ladies possess these five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”

sn37.15:1.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā …pe… ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā anuruddho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn37.15:1.1.eng: Then Venerable Anuruddha went up to the Buddha … and asked him,

sn37.15:1.2.pli: “idhāhaṃ, bhante, mātugāmaṃ passāmi dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjantaṃ.
sn37.15:1.2.eng: “Sometimes, sir, with my clairvoyance that’s purified and superhuman, I see that a lady—when her body breaks up, after death—is reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

sn37.15:1.3.pli: Katīhi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatī”ti?
sn37.15:1.3.eng: How many qualities do ladies have so that they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”

sn37.15:2.1.pli: “Pañcahi kho, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
sn37.15:2.1.eng: “Anuruddha, when ladies have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

sn37.15:2.3.pli: Saddho ca hoti, hirimā ca hoti, ottappī ca hoti, akkodhano ca hoti, paññavā ca hoti—
sn37.15:2.3.eng: They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, loving, and wise.

sn37.15:2.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatī”ti.
sn37.15:2.4.eng: When ladies possess these five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”

sn37.16:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.

sn37.16:1.3.pli: Saddho ca hoti, hirimā ca hoti, ottappī ca hoti, anupanāhī ca hoti, paññavā ca hoti—
sn37.16:1.3.eng: “… They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, free of acrimony, and wise. …”

sn37.16:1.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatī”ti.

sn37.17:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.

sn37.17:1.3.pli: Saddho ca hoti, hirimā ca hoti, ottappī ca hoti, anissukī ca hoti, paññavā ca hoti …pe….
sn37.17:1.3.eng: “… They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, free of jealousy, and wise. …”

sn37.18:1.1.eng: “… They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, free of stinginess, and wise. …”

sn37.19:1.1.eng: “… They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, not adulterous, and wise. …”

sn37.2:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato puriso ekantaamanāpo hoti mātugāmassa.
sn37.2:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when a man has five factors he is extremely undesirable to a lady.

sn37.2:1.3.pli: Na ca rūpavā hoti, na ca bhogavā hoti, na ca sīlavā hoti, alaso ca hoti, pajañcassa na labhati—
sn37.2:1.3.eng: He’s not attractive, wealthy, or ethical; he’s idle, and he doesn’t beget children.

sn37.2:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgato puriso ekantaamanāpo hoti mātugāmassa.
sn37.2:1.4.eng: When a man has these five factors he is extremely undesirable to a lady.

sn37.2:1.5.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato puriso ekantamanāpo hoti mātugāmassa.
sn37.2:1.5.eng: When a man has five factors he is extremely desirable to a lady.

sn37.2:1.7.pli: Rūpavā ca hoti, bhogavā ca hoti, sīlavā ca hoti, dakkho ca hoti analaso, pajañcassa labhati—
sn37.2:1.7.eng: He’s attractive, wealthy, and ethical; he’s deft and tireless, and he begets children.

sn37.2:1.8.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgato puriso ekantamanāpo hoti mātugāmassā”ti.
sn37.2:1.8.eng: When a man has these five factors he is extremely desirable to a lady.”

sn37.20:1.1.eng: “… They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, ethical, and wise. …”

sn37.21:1.1.eng: “… They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, learned, and wise. …”

sn37.22:1.1.eng: “… They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, energetic, and wise. …”

sn37.23:1.1.eng: “… They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, mindful, and wise. …”

sn37.23:1.2.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatī”ti.

sn37.24:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
sn37.24:1.1.eng: “Anuruddha, when ladies have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

sn37.24:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato ca hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato ca hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato ca hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato ca hoti, surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato ca hoti—
sn37.24:1.3.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

sn37.24:1.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatī”ti.
sn37.24:1.4.eng: When ladies possess these five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”

sn37.25:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five powers of a lady.

sn37.25:1.3.eng: Attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior.

sn37.25:1.4.pli: imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca mātugāmassa balāni.
sn37.25:1.4.eng: These are the five powers of a lady.

sn37.25:1.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi balehi samannāgato mātugāmo visārado agāraṃ ajjhāvasatī”ti.
sn37.25:1.5.eng: A lady living at home with these five qualities is self-assured.”
sn37.25:1.5.comm: “Self-assurance” is a quality of the Buddha (SN 7.18:6.4) and a virtuous layperson (AN 5.172).

sn37.26:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five powers of a lady.

sn37.26:1.3.eng: Attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior.

sn37.26:1.4.pli: imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca mātugāmassa balāni.
sn37.26:1.4.eng: These are the five powers of a lady.

sn37.26:1.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi balehi samannāgato mātugāmo sāmikaṃ pasayha agāraṃ ajjhāvasatī”ti.
sn37.26:1.5.eng: A lady living at home with these five powers has her husband under her thumb.”
sn37.26:1.5.comm: “Under her thumb”, literally, “having vanquished her husband” (sāmikaṁ pasayha), like Indra’s wife Sujā (Rig Veda 10.159; see note at SN 11.12:6.1).

sn37.27:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five powers of a lady.

sn37.27:1.3.eng: Attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior.

sn37.27:1.4.pli: imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca mātugāmassa balāni.
sn37.27:1.4.eng: These are the five powers of a lady.

sn37.27:1.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi balehi samannāgato mātugāmo sāmikaṃ abhibhuyya vattatī”ti.
sn37.27:1.5.eng: A lady with these five powers proceeds having mastered her husband.”
sn37.27:1.5.comm: “Proceeds having mastered” is abhibhuyya vattati (cf. AN 7.63:7.3); Rig Veda 10.159.5 has abhibhūvarī in the same sense.

sn37.28:1.1.pli: “Ekena ca kho, bhikkhave, balena samannāgato puriso mātugāmaṃ abhibhuyya vattati.
sn37.28:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, by means of one power a man proceeds having mastered a lady.

sn37.28:1.2.eng: By means of what one power?

sn37.28:1.3.pli: Issariyabalena abhibhūtaṃ mātugāmaṃ neva rūpabalaṃ tāyati, na bhogabalaṃ tāyati, na ñātibalaṃ tāyati, na puttabalaṃ tāyati, na sīlabalaṃ tāyatī”ti.
sn37.28:1.3.eng: When a lady has been mastered by the power of authority, her powers of attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior do not avail her.”
sn37.28:1.3.comm: At AN 6.52:5.2, “authority” (or “sovereignty”) is said to be a woman’s ultimate goal. An aristocrat shares the same goal, thus a king wields the power of authority (issariyabala, AN 8.27:1.3).

sn37.29:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five powers of a lady.

sn37.29:1.3.eng: Attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior.

sn37.29:1.4.pli: Rūpabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, na ca bhogabalena—
sn37.29:1.4.eng: A lady who has the power of attractiveness but not the power of wealth

sn37.29:1.6.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, mātugāmo rūpabalena ca samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca—
sn37.29:1.6.eng: But when she has the power of attractiveness and the power of wealth

sn37.29:1.8.pli: Rūpabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, na ca ñātibalena—
sn37.29:1.8.eng: A lady who has the powers of attractiveness and wealth, but not the power of relatives

sn37.29:1.10.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, mātugāmo rūpabalena ca samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, ñātibalena ca—
sn37.29:1.10.eng: But when she has the powers of attractiveness, wealth, and relatives

sn37.29:1.12.pli: Rūpabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, ñātibalena ca, na ca puttabalena—
sn37.29:1.12.eng: A lady who has the powers of attractiveness, wealth, and relatives, but not the power of children

sn37.29:1.14.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, mātugāmo rūpabalena ca samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, ñātibalena ca, puttabalena ca—
sn37.29:1.14.eng: But when she has the powers of attractiveness, wealth, relatives, and children

sn37.29:1.16.pli: Rūpabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, ñātibalena ca, puttabalena ca, na ca sīlabalena—
sn37.29:1.16.eng: A lady who has the powers of attractiveness, wealth, relatives, and children, but not the power of ethical behavior

sn37.29:1.18.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, mātugāmo rūpabalena ca samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, ñātibalena ca, puttabalena ca, sīlabalena ca—
sn37.29:1.18.eng: But when she has the powers of attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior

sn37.29:1.20.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca mātugāmassa balānī”ti.
sn37.29:1.20.eng: These are the five powers of a lady.”

sn37.3:1.1.pli: “Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, mātugāmassa āveṇikāni dukkhāni, yāni mātugāmo paccanubhoti, aññatreva purisehi.
sn37.3:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of suffering that particularly apply to ladies. They’re undergone by ladies and not by men.
sn37.3:1.1.comm: Here the Buddha expresses empathy for the lot of women in the culture of his times.

sn37.3:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mātugāmo daharova samāno patikulaṃ gacchati, ñātakehi vinā hoti.
sn37.3:1.3.eng: Firstly, a lady, while still young, goes to live with her husband’s family and is separated from her relatives.
sn37.3:1.3.comm: An unmarried girl (kumāribhūta) under twenty was said to be not mature enough for full ordination (Bi Pc 71:1.11), which is the same age as for the monks. A gihigatā of just twelve, however, might be ordained. Gihigatā is explained as “gone to the place of a man” (purisantaragatā, Bi Pc 66:2.7); i.e. a girl who is married. This item precedes menstruation, which also suggests the age of twelve. The Hindu tradition says a girl should be given in marriage before puberty (Manu 9.89; Gautama 18.21; Vaśiṣṭha 17.70; Baudhāyana 4.1.11). If no suitable husband is found, three years after puberty she is free to choose her own (Manu 9.90; Gautama 18.20; Baudhāyana 4.10.14). Yama (Vīramitrodaya Saṁskāra, p. 773) says she may choose a husband after the age of twelve.

sn37.3:1.4.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, mātugāmassa paṭhamaṃ āveṇikaṃ dukkhaṃ, yaṃ mātugāmo paccanubhoti, aññatreva purisehi.
sn37.3:1.4.eng: This is the first kind of suffering that particularly applies to ladies.

sn37.3:1.5.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, mātugāmo utunī hoti.
sn37.3:1.5.eng: Furthermore, a lady undergoes the menstrual cycle.
sn37.3:1.5.comm: Utu is “season”; it includes the fortnight that begins with menstruation (see note on MN 38:26.2).

sn37.3:1.6.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, mātugāmassa dutiyaṃ āveṇikaṃ dukkhaṃ, yaṃ mātugāmo paccanubhoti, aññatreva purisehi.
sn37.3:1.6.eng: This is the second kind of suffering that particularly applies to ladies.

sn37.3:1.7.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, mātugāmo gabbhinī hoti.

sn37.3:1.8.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, mātugāmassa tatiyaṃ āveṇikaṃ dukkhaṃ, yaṃ mātugāmo paccanubhoti, aññatreva purisehi.
sn37.3:1.8.eng: This is the third kind of suffering that particularly applies to ladies.

sn37.3:1.10.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, mātugāmassa catutthaṃ āveṇikaṃ dukkhaṃ, yaṃ mātugāmo paccanubhoti, aññatreva purisehi.
sn37.3:1.10.eng: This is the fourth kind of suffering that particularly applies to ladies.

sn37.3:1.11.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, mātugāmo purisassa pāricariyaṃ upeti.
sn37.3:1.11.eng: Furthermore, a lady provides services for a man.
sn37.3:1.11.comm: The mutual obligations of husbands and wives are mentioned from a Buddhist perspective at DN 31:30.1, where the wife is not said to “serve” the husband, but to be kind to him. A wife’s “service” (pāricariya) was domestic and also sexual (Bu Ss 4:1.2.7). No Buddhist text, however, justifies the use of violence in marriage (as at Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 6.4.7). Manu 9.3 says a woman must always be subject to a man, whether father, husband, or son. Manu 9.11 lists a wife’s duties such as managing household finances, cleaning, cooking, and housekeeping, as well as minor religious observances.

sn37.3:1.12.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mātugāmassa pañcamaṃ āveṇikaṃ dukkhaṃ, yaṃ mātugāmo paccanubhoti, aññatreva purisehi.
sn37.3:1.12.eng: This is the fifth kind of suffering that particularly applies to ladies.

sn37.3:1.13.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca mātugāmassa āveṇikāni dukkhāni, yāni mātugāmo paccanubhoti, aññatreva purisehī”ti.
sn37.3:1.13.eng: These are the five kinds of suffering that particularly apply to ladies. They’re undergone by ladies and not by men.”

sn37.30:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five powers of a lady.

sn37.30:1.3.eng: Attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior.

sn37.30:1.4.pli: Rūpabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, na ca sīlabalena, nāsenteva naṃ, kule na vāsenti.
sn37.30:1.4.eng: If a lady has the power of attractiveness but not that of ethical behavior, the family will send her away, they won’t accommodate her.

sn37.30:1.5.pli: Rūpabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, na ca sīlabalena, nāsenteva naṃ, kule na vāsenti.
sn37.30:1.5.eng: If a lady has the powers of attractiveness and wealth but not that of ethical behavior, the family will send her away, they won’t accommodate her.

sn37.30:1.6.pli: Rūpabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, ñātibalena ca, na ca sīlabalena, nāsenteva naṃ, kule na vāsenti.
sn37.30:1.6.eng: If a lady has the powers of attractiveness, wealth, and relatives, but not that of ethical behavior, the family will send her away, they won’t accommodate her.

sn37.30:1.7.pli: Rūpabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, bhogabalena ca, ñātibalena ca, puttabalena ca, na ca sīlabalena, nāsenteva naṃ, kule na vāsenti.
sn37.30:1.7.eng: If a lady has the powers of attractiveness, wealth, relatives, and children, but not that of ethical behavior, the family will send her away, they won’t accommodate her.

sn37.30:1.8.pli: Sīlabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, na ca rūpabalena, vāsenteva naṃ, kule na nāsenti.
sn37.30:1.8.eng: If a lady has the power of ethical behavior but not that of attractiveness, the family will accommodate her, they won’t send her away.

sn37.30:1.9.pli: Sīlabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, na ca bhogabalena, vāsenteva naṃ, kule na nāsenti.
sn37.30:1.9.eng: If a lady has the power of ethical behavior but not that of wealth, the family will accommodate her, they won’t send her away.

sn37.30:1.10.pli: Sīlabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, na ca ñātibalena, vāsenteva naṃ, kule na nāsenti.
sn37.30:1.10.eng: If a lady has the power of ethical behavior but not that of relatives, the family will accommodate her, they won’t send her away.

sn37.30:1.11.pli: Sīlabalena ca, bhikkhave, mātugāmo samannāgato hoti, na ca puttabalena, vāsenteva naṃ, kule na nāsenti.
sn37.30:1.11.eng: If a lady has the power of ethical behavior but not that of children, the family will accommodate her, they won’t send her away.

sn37.30:1.12.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca mātugāmassa balānī”ti.
sn37.30:1.12.eng: These are the five powers of a lady.”

sn37.31:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five powers of a lady.

sn37.31:1.3.eng: Attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior.

sn37.31:1.4.pli: Na, bhikkhave, mātugāmo rūpabalahetu vā bhogabalahetu vā ñātibalahetu vā puttabalahetu vā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
sn37.31:1.4.eng: It is not because of the powers of attractiveness, wealth, relatives, or children that ladies, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

sn37.31:1.5.pli: Sīlabalahetu kho, bhikkhave, mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
sn37.31:1.5.eng: It is because of the power of ethical behavior that ladies, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

sn37.31:1.6.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca mātugāmassa balānī”ti.
sn37.31:1.6.eng: These are the five powers of a lady.”

sn37.32:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are five things that are hard to get for ladies who have not made merit.

sn37.32:1.3.eng: ‘May I be born into a suitable family!’

sn37.32:1.4.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:1.5.pli: Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gaccheyyanti—
sn37.32:1.5.eng: ‘Having been born in a suitable family, may I marry into a suitable family!’

sn37.32:1.6.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:1.7.pli: Patirūpe kule jāyitvā, patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā, asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvaseyyanti—
sn37.32:1.7.eng: ‘Having been born in a suitable family and married into a suitable family, may I live at home without a co-wife!’
sn37.32:1.7.comm: AN 6.52:5.2 says a woman insists she be without a co-wife. In Rig Veda 10.159, Sujā performs oblations to gain the power of stripping luster from her co-wives and thus vanquishing them.

sn37.32:1.8.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:1.9.pli: Patirūpe kule jāyitvā, patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā, asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvasantī puttavatī assanti—
sn37.32:1.9.eng: ‘Having been born in a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, may I have children!’

sn37.32:1.10.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, catutthaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:1.11.pli: Patirūpe kule jāyitvā, patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā, asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvasantī puttavatī samānā sāmikaṃ abhibhuyya vatteyyanti—
sn37.32:1.11.eng: ‘Having been born in a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, and having had children, may I live having mastered my husband!’

sn37.32:1.12.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:1.13.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca ṭhānāni dullabhāni akatapuññena mātugāmenāti.
sn37.32:1.13.eng: These are the five things that are hard to get for ladies who have not made merit.

sn37.32:2.1.pli: Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, ṭhānāni sulabhāni katapuññena mātugāmena.
sn37.32:2.1.eng: There are five things that are easy to get for ladies who have made merit.

sn37.32:2.3.eng: ‘May I be born into a suitable family!’

sn37.32:2.4.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:2.5.pli: Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gaccheyyanti—
sn37.32:2.5.eng: ‘Having been born into a suitable family, may I marry into a suitable family!’

sn37.32:2.6.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:2.7.pli: Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvaseyyanti—
sn37.32:2.7.eng: ‘Having been born into a suitable family and married into a suitable family, may I live at home without a co-wife!’

sn37.32:2.8.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:2.9.pli: Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvasantī puttavatī assanti—
sn37.32:2.9.eng: ‘Having been born into a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, may I have children!’

sn37.32:2.10.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, catutthaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:2.11.pli: Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvasantī puttavatī samānā sāmikaṃ abhibhuyya vatteyyanti—
sn37.32:2.11.eng: ‘Having been born into a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, and having had children, may I live having mastered my husband!’

sn37.32:2.12.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.

sn37.32:2.13.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca ṭhānāni sulabhāni katapuññena mātugāmenā”ti.
sn37.32:2.13.eng: These are the five things that are easy to get for ladies who have made merit.”

sn37.33:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo visārado agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
sn37.33:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a lady living at home with five qualities is self-assured.

sn37.33:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato ca hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato ca hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato ca hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato ca hoti, surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato ca hoti—
sn37.33:1.3.eng: She doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

sn37.33:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo visārado agāraṃ ajjhāvasatī”ti.
sn37.33:1.4.eng: A lady living at home with these five qualities is self-assured.”

sn37.34:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamānā ariyasāvikā ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati sārādāyinī ca hoti varādāyinī ca kāyassa.
sn37.34:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a female noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.

sn37.34:1.3.pli: Saddhāya vaḍḍhati, sīlena vaḍḍhati, sutena vaḍḍhati, cāgena vaḍḍhati, paññāya vaḍḍhati—
sn37.34:1.3.eng: She grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

sn37.34:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamānā ariyasāvikā ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati, sārādāyinī ca hoti, varādāyinī ca kāyassāti.
sn37.34:1.4.eng: A female noble disciple who grows in these five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.

sn37.34:2.1.eng: When she grows in faith and ethics,

sn37.34:2.2.eng: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—

sn37.34:2.3.eng: a virtuous laywoman such as she

sn37.34:2.4.eng: takes on what is essential for herself in this life.”

sn37.34:3.5.eng: The Linked Discourses on ladies are complete.

sn37.4:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo yebhuyyena kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
sn37.4:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when ladies have three qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are mostly reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

sn37.4:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mātugāmo pubbaṇhasamayaṃ maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
sn37.4:1.3.eng: A female lives at home with a heart full of the stain of stinginess in the morning, jealousy in the afternoon, and sexual desire in the evening.

sn37.4:1.6.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo yebhuyyena kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatī”ti.
sn37.4:1.6.eng: When ladies possess these three qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are mostly reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
